name: Legendary Noise
description: Here is a deck that I enjoy playing with. Sahasrara gives you money to install viruses, Gorman makes a good economy card combined with Sahasrara and Shceherazade and synergize with Noise ability. Hostage is here to tutor your Connection card at the right time (especially for tutoring Professional Contacts). Aesop gives you nice econ too, when Imp is empty or wiped by corp. Gorman is really powerful in this deck.

name: PAIN
description:
The purpose of this experimental deck is to misdirect the runner with a sort of shell game, creating a relatively high number of advanced remotes. If the runner has no way to expose the cards, he is forced to a guessing game. Even if he manages to find agendas, they are many, low-valued and painful, thanks to this identity.
The Ice are few and mostly damaging. The corp should not care whether the runner breaks in: the crucial objective is trying to flatline him! ;)

name: Jinteki Run to me 1.0
description: First attempt to create a decent Jinteki with a minimun of economy and some treu traps for the runner. Just for fun.

name: Jinteki spirit v 1.1
description:
With the new 3/1 and 2/1 agendas now even Jinteki can do some Fast Advance, thanks to its better quality: fear.

A lot of traps and Trick of Light can help to create a situation that force the runner to run blind.

With Snare! as protection for HQ and Hokusai and some big ICE on R&D, you can concentrate on remote.

Still need some test and improvement.
Any criticism is welcome.

name: NBN:Chuming the News.
description: I feel chum is a good choice because NBN has a lot of ice whose routines don't get broken so much as bypassed. Pop up window, tollbooth, data raven, all tend to be bypassed or run through without breaking. The chum can also change the strength of an ice your opponent set an Atman to. Muckraker is just an expensive piece to break, with the +2 star from chum it's now out of mimic range without data suckers. Otherwise the deck is geared towards money and punishing the runner (specifically criminal) with Invasion of Privacy.

name: Tag, I win.
description: My attempt at a psycho deck. Lots of tag ice and chums to punish runners trying to force their way through or bankrupt them trying to break ice.

name: Supermodernism vH.J
description: I don't claim ownership of this deck concept. It's simply my version of the super modernism on the popular deck list. I went 6/20 in a local tourney. I hadn't played in 8+ weeks and my 6th place was more from lack of experience with the deck and a weaker runner deck. This was hands down the star of my night. 3 W 2 L on corp side. The 2 losses were the first two games then I got a feel for the deck and won the last 3. One agenda win and two flat line wins.

name: NBN:Chuming the News. v1.1
description: V1.1 I dropped two celebrity gifts and a tollbooth for 3 caduceus.

name: NBN:Chuming the News. v1.3
description: -2 ice wall, -2 San San city grid. +1 ASH, + 1 closed accounts, +2 Bernice mal.

name: Rich Tagger.
description: Make money. Tag. Psychographics/mid seasons/closed acct. I took out 3 melange for 3 restructure. I want to play test both ways though.

name: Rich Tagger V1.1
description: I forgot I had the influence for 3 Green level clearance instead of restructure or melange.

name: Kates workshop
description: x3r0h0ur convinced me PW is stronger with all the bad publicity coming out and I agree after the tournament Saturday. I went with 3 PW and hostage to dig out kati/PC or John if I have the others. I saw John twice at the tour nay and he was good, both times it was for criminal but I want to see if he helps as much here. Single programs to dig or recurse as needed. Test run/scavenge was gold in the tourney and I constantly wished I had a third of each. Dyson chip for MU/Link. I would like to get 2-3 rabbit holes if my meta winds up having a lot of NBN and/or trace. I'm not sure what to cut. Dinosaurus was a dead card in the tourney for me. I don't have the influence for another console. Constructive criticism welcome. Thanks.

name: Kit RD rush Update - Escher in!
description:
Compare this to Kit RD rush. I've stuck in 2 eschers, mostly to be sure you get it rather than losing it to damage, and to get it sooner.

I've added pro contacts (and 3 of them!) to facilitate draw and fuel the super cheap breaks. I've removed sure gambles for daily casts and escher, since it feels redundant in mopus decks for me. Casts however, will save you clicks, which you can now use to dig AND gain money.

I have addressed those MU issues people were complaining about with the best possible method, akamatsus. Sure omnidrive is up for discussion, but I feel like 3 is too much for it, and it'll take a lot longer to catch up to the opportunity cost of 3 and 1 click (which is worth 2c with mopus out, or 1c and 1 card with contacts).

Let me know what you think of the changes.
